ground_truth_answer: In both settings, designated areas serve crucial safety functions. In mechanics' shops, designated areas are marked by painted aisles on the floor to define work area boundaries where only authorized mechanics and service technicians are permitted to enter, and these areas help separate short-term repairs from major repairs requiring longer completion times. In roofing work, designated work zones are established to protect workers below from falling debris during material removal, and specific areas must be designated for safely staging new materials on the roof to prevent trip hazards.
